summary: The Status Module displays real-time server statistics and performance metrics through a web interface at /server-status. It shows information about server uptime, CPU usage, request statistics, connection information, and worker/thread status, enabling administrators to monitor Apache server performance.

logs.message_template: Server status unavailable in inetd mode
logs.reason: This error is logged when the scoreboard image is not available, which typically happens when Apache is running in inetd mode. The status module requires a scoreboard to function properly.
logs.resolution: This error indicates that the server-status page cannot be displayed because Apache is running in inetd mode, which doesn't maintain a scoreboard. If you need server status information, reconfigure Apache to run in standalone mode rather than inetd mode.
